intro: Xolisma formosana var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy xolisma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its hairy foliage and distinctive inflorescences that bear small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland or shrubland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves with a rough texture and showy, often pale yellow or white flowers. It is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
